svg.text: Money vs Database: Key Players and Arguments

g.text: ‚Ä¢ Educate users to switch from Core to Knots

svg.text: Bitcoin Core vs Bitcoin Knots: Key Differences

g.text: Allows Ordinals and BRC-20 inscriptions by default
OP_RETURN limit: 80 bytes (may increase with PR #32359)
Follows Bitcoin Core dev team consensus
Widely used by exchanges and services

svg.text: ‚Ä¢ The monetary purists are fighting to preserve Bitcoin's original vision as sound money
‚Ä¢ Recent developments like Ordinals and BRC-20 tokens threaten this vision with spam
‚Ä¢ Ocean Mining Pool and Bitcoin Knots represent practical resistance to protocol abuse
‚Ä¢ PR #32359 and OP_CAT proposals show ongoing attempts to expand non-monetary uses
‚Ä¢ The battle continues between those who want Bitcoin as pristine money vs. a data platform
The Fight for Bitcoin's Soul: Money vs. Everything Else
Defending Bitcoin's monetary purpose against spam and protocol manipulation
